verses.roman:
sundara śarīra yaiche bhūṣaṇe bhūṣita
eka śveta-kuṣṭhe yaiche karaye vigīta

synonyms: sundara—beautiful; śarīra—body; yaiche—as; bhūṣaṇe—with ornaments; bhūṣita—decorated; eka—one; śveta-kuṣṭhe—with a white spot of leprosy; yaiche—as; karaye—is made; vigīta—abominable.
translation: "One's beautiful body may be decorated with jewels, but one spot of white leprosy makes the entire body abominable.

purport.content: The great sage Bharata Muni, an authority on poetic metaphor, has given his opinion in this connection as follows.
